docs.title: Notes & rules
docs.text:
• by <...BASE_URL...> is understood the static URL part of this site (ie server name, host name), more exactly http://dataapi.renware.eu/. Usual followed by a path to specific data

  • for deprecated version go here

  • End User Manual
    • Routes general rules
    • Data format
    • Route methods
    • Getting the information

docs.title: End User Manual
docs.text:
This document presents RENware Software Systems company data API application provider. It refer the public company data.

General information:

  • product p/n: 0000-0051
  • API type: HTTP REST for data purposes

docs.title: Routes general rules
docs.text:
There are 2 kind of routes:

  • strict data GET routes, prefixed as .../data_sources/[entity name/object name]

  • "real" API routes that are able for complete CRUD operations to data, prefixed as .../api/<entity name>/<operation>/<object name>...

-#TODO: explain route parameters

-#TODO: other rules here ...

docs.title: Notes & rules
docs.text: • by ...base_url... is understood the static URL part of this site, ie http://dataapi.renware.eu/. Usual followed by a path to specific data

docs.title: About the .../data_sources/ directory
docs.text:
• This directory is intended to keep local data sources in various forms but the most practiced will be probably JSON

  • Directory is subject to being updated by "external" systems (such a procedure in a database server which produce here JSON files)

  • Also this directory behavior, as seen by Web HTTP Server, is READ ONLY
